rmacrostrat 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Get lithology data from Macrostrat

Source: R/get_lithology.R
get_lithology.Rd

This function gets lithology data from Macrostrat.

Usage

get_lithology(x = NULL, by = "name", available = FALSE)

Arguments

x

character. The name of a lithology available via Macrostrat.

by

character. The rank to search name by, should be either: "name", "group", "type", or "class".

available

logical. If set to TRUE, a vector of the available lithologies will be returned. If set to FALSE (default), the requested lithology will be checked against those available.

Value

A vector of available lithologies or a data.frame of the requested Macrostrat lithology containing at least the following columns:

lith_id

Lithology ID number.

name

Name of lithology.

type

Type of lithology.

group

Group of lithology.

class

Class of lithology.

color

Assigned lithology colour.

Details

This function returns a data.frame of the requested lithology and related data. Available Macrostrat lithologies can be requested via the available argument. Note: if this argument is set to TRUE, only a vector of available lithologies are returned. To return the desired lithology, this argument should be set to FALSE.

Examples

# Get lithology by name
get_lithology(by = "name", available = TRUE)
#>   [1] "siliciclastic"                 "gravel"                       
#>   [3] "sand"                          "silt"                         
#>   [5] "mud"                           "claystone"                    
#>   [7] "mudstone"                      "shale"                        
#>   [9] "siltstone"                     "sandstone"

# Get lithology by type
get_lithology(by = "type", available = TRUE)
#>  [1] "siliciclastic"   "carbonate"       "evaporite"       "organic"        
#>  [5] "chemical"        "plutonic"        "volcanic"        "metamorphic"    
#>  [9] "metasedimentary" "metavolcanic"    "igneous"         "sedimentary"    
#> [13] "metaigneous"     "regolith"        "cataclastic"    
# Get lithology by group
get_lithology(by = "group", available = TRUE)
#> [1] "unconsolidated" "mudrocks"       "sandstones"     "conglomerates" 
#> [5] "Dunham"         "felsic"         "mafic"          "ultramafic"    
#> [9] "Folk"          
# Get lithology by class
get_lithology(by = "class", available = TRUE)
#> [1] "sedimentary" "igneous"     "metamorphic"
# Get all sedimentary lithologies
get_lithology(x = "sedimentary", by = "class", available = FALSE)

# Get specific lithology
get_lithology(x = "limestone", by = "name", available = FALSE)
#>   lith_id      name      type group       class   color fill t_units
#> 1      30 limestone carbonate    NA sedimentary #4C71F1  627    9590
